title: A&S researchers create solution that removes more than 98% of nanoplastics from water | College of Arts and Science
text:
Wednesday, August 14, 2024 - 17:00 pm
Department/Program
Chemistry
Researchers in the College of Arts and Science recently created a liquid-based solution that eliminates more than 98% of nanoplastics from water. These microscopic plastic particles are an international concern, found in the worldâ€™s bodies of water and linked to health issues such as cardiovascular and respiratory disease. The innovative method offers a practical solution to nanoplastic pollution and paves the way for further research and development in advanced water purification technologies.
